snippet.title: Crown Resorts profits hit by VIP revenue fall after China arrests
snippet.content:
James Packer's Crown Resorts has been hit by a fall in VIP gambling revenue, suffering double-digit profit and revenue falls for the 2017 financial year. The casino and entertainment giant recorded normalised net profit after tax of $343 million from revenue of $3.24 billion, down 15.65 per cent and 10 per cent respectively from the previous year. Crown's VIP program revenue fell from $1 billion in 2016 to about $605 million. The company was hit by the arrest of 18 employees and associates in China last October,
Mr Packer officially re-joined the Crown board on Thursday, with Guy Jalland also being named director.
